snippet: Passengers on an Air France flight to Beirut, Lebanon, had two surprises on board: a stop in Damascus, and a request for cash to help pay refueling costs.
abstract: Air France Flight 562, headed from Paris to Beirut, Lebanon, is unable to land because of unrest around Beirut's airport, and is rerouted to Syria; crew asks passengers to help pay for refueling costs since sanctions blocked them from using credit.
lead_paragraph: Passengers on an Air France flight to Beirut, Lebanon, had two surprises on board: a stop in Damascus, and a request for cash to help pay refueling costs.

headline.seo: Rerouted to Syria, Air France Passengers Asked to Pass the Hat
headline.main: Rerouted to Syria, Travelers Are Asked To Pass the Hat
headline.print_headline: Rerouted to Syria, Travelers Are Asked To Pass the Hat
